key_mistakes.reason: Allows a strong attack; h6 would have been better to challenge the pinned bishop.
Gives up a powerful bishop for a knight, deteriorating the pawn structure.
Does not apply enough pressure; better to improve the position of the bishop.
Misses an opportunity to challenge the center with a pawn break.
Allows White to gain tempo and improve position.
Misses a tactical opportunity to capture a piece.
A blunder that allows Black to win material with a tactical sequence.
A blunder that allows a strong counterattack.
Misplaces a piece leading to a vulnerable position.
Unnecessary king move that weakens the position.

recommendations: Focus on maintaining a strong pawn structure and avoid unnecessary exchanges.
Ensure your pieces are active and well-coordinated.
Pay attention to king safety and avoid leaving the king exposed.
Control the center consistently to maintain an advantage.
